title: Apple Requirements: Verify that the application doesn't crash on startup
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed the application
And we are currently not inside the application
custom_steps: When we tap on the applications launcher icon
custom_expected:
Then the application launches successfully
And the application doesn't crash

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that the application doesn't crash during Navigation
custom_preconds: Given we have launched the application
custom_steps: When we navigate around the application

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that the application doesn't have an abundant amount of obvious defects
custom_preconds:
Given we have launched the application
And we have navigated around the application
And we have cross referenced JIRA for the current release
And there are not an abundant amount of defects
custom_expected: Then the application is ready for release

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that the application performs as advertised by the Developer
custom_preconds:
Given that the Developer has stated the application should perform in a certain way
And we have Navigated around the application
custom_expected: Then the application performs in the way that the Developer had stated

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that the application doesn't include undocumented or hidden features inconsistent with the description
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed the application
And we have navigation around the application
And we have read the applications description
custom_expected:
Then the application doesn't include undocumented features not consistent with the description
And the application doesn't include hidden features not consistent with the description

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that the application name and/or description doesn't contain the terms of Beta, Demo, Trial or Test
custom_preconds: Given we have installed the application
custom_expected:
Then the application name doesn't contain the terms of Beta, Demo, Trial, Test
And the applications description doesn't contain the terms of Beta, Demo, Trial, Test

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that the application doesn't provide trick or fake functionality that it not clearly marked
custom_preconds:
Given we have read the applications description
And we have installed the application
And we have navigated around the application
custom_expected:
Then the application doesn't display any trick functionality
And the application doesn't display any fake functionality

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that all images inside of the application support both Retina and non-Retina displays
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed the application
And we have navigated around the application
custom_expected:
Then the images inside of the application support Retina displays
And the images inside of the application support non-Retina displays

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that the Audio-Only Slate will appear inside of the Media Player if there is limited connectivity during Video Playback
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed the application
And we have started up the Media Player
And there is limited connectivity
custom_expected:
Then an Audio-Only slate will appear to the user while they have limited connectivity
And will disappear when the users connection improves

title: Apple Requirements: Verify the app does not require license keys or implement it's own copy protection
custom_preconds: Given we have started the installation process for the application
custom_steps: When the user is following the installation process
custom_expected: The user should not be prompted for a license key and should not encounter any means of app copy protection warnings

title: Apple Requirements: Verify the app does not use any update mechanism outisde of the app store
custom_preconds: Given the app has been installed
custom_expected: Then these should be no other way to update other then the Mac app store

title: Apple Requirement: Verify that the application does not add itself to the Dock or leave short cuts on the users desktop
custom_preconds: Given the application has been installed
custom_steps: When the installation process if completed
custom_expected: Then the application should not add itself to the Dock or leave short cuts on the users desktop

title: Apple Requirement: Verify that if the application has any 'run at startup' or spawned process that continue running after the app is quit, that user consent is required
custom_preconds: Given the app has been installed
custom_steps:
When the user starts the application
Or the user quits the application
custom_expected: Then the application will not have any 'run at startup' or background processes without first getting the user's consent first

title: Apple Requirement: Verify app contrains all language support in single App bundle
custom_preconds: Given the application has been installed
custom_steps: When the app is accessed using a language other than English
custom_expected: The app can support localization language support without requiring additional installations or updates

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that the application is self-contained, single application installation bundles, and cannot install code or resources in shared locations
custom_preconds: Given the app has been installed
custom_steps: When the user verifies the installation folder of the application
custom_expected: Then the application is self-contained, single application installation bundles, and cannot install code or resources in shared locations

title: Apple Requirements: Verify that users cannot make any purchases or access flows that allow users to purchase content outside of the In App Purchase API provided by Apple
custom_preconds: Given the app has been installed
custom_steps: When the user accesses all areas of the application
custom_expected: Then there will be no way for the user to make any purchases or access flows that allow users to purchase content outside of the In App Purchase API provided by Apple

title: Upgrade from a previous version
custom_preconds:
Given you have the Release version A (5.1) installed
And login into an MLB.com account
custom_steps: When you install Release version B (5.2)
custom_expected:
Then you will not be prompted with the PayWall
And your MLB.com account credentials will be saved
